symbols.name: sap.ui.richtexteditor
symbols.description: A rich text editor (RTE) control. Requires installation of an additional rich text editor library.

nodes.name: sap.ui.richtexteditor.EditorType
nodes.description: Determines which editor component should be used for editing the text.

nodes.name: sap.ui.richtexteditor.IToolbar
nodes.description: Interface for controls which are suitable as a Toolbar for RichTextEditor.

nodes.name: sap.ui.richtexteditor.RichTextEditor
nodes.description: The RichTextEditor-Control is used to enter formatted text.

symbols.title: namespace sap.ui.richtexteditor

symbols.name: sap.ui.richtexteditor.EditorType
symbols.description: Determines which editor component should be used for editing the text.

properties.name: sap.ui.richtexteditor.EditorType.TinyMCE
properties.description: Uses TinyMCE version 3 as editor (default)

properties.name: sap.ui.richtexteditor.EditorType.TinyMCE4
properties.description: Uses TinyMCE version 4 as editor

symbols.title: enum sap.ui.richtexteditor.EditorType

symbols.name: sap.ui.richtexteditor.IToolbar
symbols.description: Interface for controls which are suitable as a Toolbar for RichTextEditor.
symbols.title: interface sap.ui.richtexteditor.IToolbar

symbols.name: sap.ui.richtexteditor.RichTextEditor
symbols.description:
The RichTextEditor-Control is used to enter formatted text. It uses the third-party component called TinyMCE. In addition to the native toolbar, you can also use a toolbar built with SAPUI5 controls.

Overview

With version 1.48 onward, aside from the native toolbar of the TinyMCE, the RichTextEditor can also use a toolbar built with SAPUI5 controls. Which toolbar is used is taken into consideration only while the control is being initialized and it will not be possible to change it during runtime, because of lifecycle incompatibilities between the SAPUI5 and the third-party library. The custom toolbar acts like a wrapper to the native toolbar and takes care of synchronizing the state of its internal controls with the current state of the selection in the editor (bold, italics, font styles etc.).

Limitations

Note: The RichTextEditor uses a third-party component and therefore some additional limitations apply for its proper usage and support. For more information see the Preamble section in sap.ui.richtexteditor.

Guidelines

  • The RichTextEditor should be used for desktop apps only.
  • In order to be usable, the control needs a minimum width 17.5 rem and height of 12.5 rem.
  • Do not instantiate the RichTextEditor from a hidden container.
  • Make sure you destroy the RichTextEditor instance instead of hiding it and create a new one when you show it again.

Usage

When to use

  • You want to enable users to enter text and other elements (tables, images) with different styles and colors.
  • You need to provide a tool for texts that require additional formatting.

When not to use

  • You want to let users add simple text that doesnâ€™t require formatting. Use text area instead.
  • Use callbacks to the native third-party API with care, as there may be compatibility issues with later versions.

properties.name: buttonGroups
properties.description: An array of button configurations. These configurations contain the names of buttons as array in the property "buttons" and the name of the group in "name", they can also contain the "row" where the buttons should be placed, a "priority" and whether the buttons are "visible". See method addButtonGroup() for more details on the structure of the objects in this array.

properties.name: customToolbar
properties.description:
Determines whether a Fiori Toolbar is used instead of the TinyMCE default toolbar one. It is applied only when the EditorType is TinyMCE4 and sap.m library is loaded. Note: The customToolbar property will have effect only on initial loading. Changing it during runtime will not affect the initially loaded toolbar.

Since: 1.48.

properties.name: editable
properties.description: Determines whether the editor content can be modified by the user. When set to "false" there might not be any editor toolbar.

properties.name: editorLocation
properties.description: Relative or absolute URL where the editor is available. Must be on the same server. Note: Any attempts to set this property after the first rendering will not have any effect.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.25.0. The editorLocation is set implicitly when choosing the editorType.

properties.name: editorType
properties.description:
The editor implementation to use.

Valid values are the ones found under sap.ui.richtexteditor.EditorType and any other editor identifier that may be introduced by other groups (hence this is not an enumeration).

Notes:

  • TinyMCE version 3 is no longer supported and cannot be used. If you set the property to TinyMCE, it will load TinyMCE version 4.
  • Any attempts to set this property after the first rendering will not have any effect.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Height of RichTextEditor control in CSS units. Note: If the height property results in a value smaller than 200px, the minimum height of 200px will be applied.

properties.name: plugins
properties.description: An array of plugin configuration objects with the obligatory property "name". Each object has to contain a property "name" which then contains the plugin name/ID.

properties.name: required
properties.description: Determines whether a value is required.

properties.name: sanitizeValue
properties.description: Determines whether to run the HTML sanitizer once the value (HTML markup) is applied or not. To configure allowed URLs please use the whitelist API via jQuery.sap.addUrlWhitelist

properties.name: showGroupClipboard
properties.description: Determines whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Cut, Copy and Paste is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

properties.name: showGroupFont
properties.description: Determines whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Font, Font Size and Colors is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

properties.name: showGroupFontStyle
properties.description: Determines whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Bold, Italic, Underline and Strikethrough is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

properties.name: showGroupInsert
properties.description: Determines whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Insert Image and Insert Smiley is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

properties.name: showGroupLink
properties.description: Determines whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Create Link and Remove Link is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

properties.name: showGroupStructure
properties.description: Determines whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Bullets and Indentation is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

properties.name: showGroupTextAlign
properties.description: Determines whether the toolbar button group containing text alignment commands is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

properties.name: showGroupUndo
properties.description: Determines whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Undo and Redo is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description: The text direction

properties.name: useLegacyTheme
properties.description: Determines whether or not to use the legacy theme for the toolbar buttons. If this is set to false, the default theme for the editor will be used (which might change slightly with every update). The legacy theme has the disadvantage that not all functionality has its own icon, so using non default buttons might lead to invisible buttons with the legacy theme - use the default editor theme in this case.

properties.name: value
properties.description: An HTML string representing the editor content. Because this is HTML, the value cannot be generically escaped to prevent cross-site scripting, so the application is responsible for doing so. Overwriting this property would also reset editor's Undo manager and buttons "Undo"/"Redo" would be set to their initial state.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of RichTextEditor control in CSS units.

properties.name: wrapping
properties.description: Determines whether the text in the editor is wrapped. This does not affect the editor's value, only the representation in the control.

aggregations.name: _toolbarWrapper
aggregations.description: Custom toolbar wrapper. The wrapper gets instantiated when customToolbar property is set to true.

aggregations.name: customButtons
aggregations.description: Custom buttons are meant to extend the RichTextEditor's custom toolbar. Though type is set to sap.ui.Control, only sap.m.Button is allowed. Note: customButtons are available only when the customToolbar is enabled and all the requirements are fulfilled.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new RichTextEditor.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: beforeEditorInit
events.description: This event is fired right before the TinyMCE instance is created and can be used to change the settings object that will be given to TinyMCE. The parameter "configuration" is the javascript oject that will be given to TinyMCE upon first instantiation. The configuration parameter contains a map that can be changed in the case of TinyMCE.

events.name: change

parameters.name: newValue
parameters.description: The new control value.

events.description: Event is fired when the text in the field has changed AND the focus leaves the editor or when the Enter key is pressed.

events.name: ready
events.description: Fired when the used editor is loaded and ready (its HTML is also created).

events.name: readyRecurring
events.description: Analogous to the ready event, the event is fired when the used editor is loaded and ready. But the event is fired after every time the control is ready to use and not only once like the ready event.

methods.name: addButtonGroup

returnValue.description: Control instance (for method chaining)

parameters.name: mGroup
parameters.description: Name/ID of a single button or object containing the group information

parameters.name: buttons
parameters.description: Array of name/IDs of the buttons in the group

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name/ID of the group.

parameters.name: visible
parameters.description: (optional) The priority of the button group. Lower priorities are added first.

parameters.name: row
parameters.description: (optional) Row number in which the button should be

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: (optional) The priority of the button group. Lower priorities are added first.

parameters.name: customToolbarPriority
parameters.description: (optional) The priority of the button group in the custom toolbar. Each default group in the custom toolbar has a predefined customToolbarPriority. Lower priorities are added in first.

methods.description: Adds a button group to the editor.

methods.name: addCustomButton

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oCustomButton
parameters.description: The customButton to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

methods.description: Adds some customButton to the aggregation customButtons.

methods.name: addPlugin

returnValue.description: Control instance (for method chaining)

parameters.name: mPlugin
parameters.description: The plugin ID/name or an object with property "name", containing the ID/name of the plugin

methods.description: Allows to add a plugin (that must already be installed on the server) to the RichTextEditor.

methods.name: attachBeforeEditorInit

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.richtexteditor.RichTextEditor itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the beforeEditorInit event of this sap.ui.richtexteditor.RichTextEditor.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.richtexteditor.RichTextEditor itself.

This event is fired right before the TinyMCE instance is created and can be used to change the settings object that will be given to TinyMCE. The parameter "configuration" is the javascript oject that will be given to TinyMCE upon first instantiation. The configuration parameter contains a map that can be changed in the case of TinyMCE.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.richtexteditor.RichTextEditor itself

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.richtexteditor.RichTextEditor itself.

Event is fired when the text in the field has changed AND the focus leaves the editor or when the Enter key is pressed.

methods.name: destroyCustomButtons

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Destroys all the customButtons in the aggregation customButtons.

methods.name: detachBeforeEditorInit

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description:
Detaches event handler fnFunction from the beforeEditorInit event of this sap.ui.richtexteditor.RichTextEditor.

The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

methods.name: sap.ui.richtexteditor.RichTextEditor.extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description:
Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.richtexteditor.RichTextEditor with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.ui.core.Control.extend.

methods.name: fireBeforeEditorInit

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.description: Parameters to pass along with the event

methods.description: Fires event beforeEditorInit to attached listeners.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.description: Parameters to pass along with the event

parameters.name: newValue
parameters.description: The new control value.

methods.description: Fires event change to attached listeners.

methods.name: fireReady

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: mParameters
parameters.description: Parameters to pass along with the event

methods.description: Fires event ready to attached listeners.

methods.name: fireReadyRecurring

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: mParameters
parameters.description: Parameters to pass along with the event

methods.description: Fires event readyRecurring to attached listeners.

methods.name: getButtonGroups

returnValue.description: Value of property buttonGroups

methods.description:
Gets current value of property buttonGroups.

An array of button configurations. These configurations contain the names of buttons as array in the property "buttons" and the name of the group in "name", they can also contain the "row" where the buttons should be placed, a "priority" and whether the buttons are "visible". See method addButtonGroup() for more details on the structure of the objects in this array.

Default value is [].

methods.name: getCustomButtons
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation customButtons.

Custom buttons are meant to extend the RichTextEditor's custom toolbar. Though type is set to sap.ui.Control, only sap.m.Button is allowed. Note: customButtons are available only when the customToolbar is enabled and all the requirements are fulfilled.

methods.name: getCustomToolbar

returnValue.description: Value of property customToolbar

methods.description:
Gets current value of property customToolbar.

Determines whether a Fiori Toolbar is used instead of the TinyMCE default toolbar one. It is applied only when the EditorType is TinyMCE4 and sap.m library is loaded. Note: The customToolbar property will have effect only on initial loading. Changing it during runtime will not affect the initially loaded toolbar.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getEditable

returnValue.description: Value of property editable

methods.description:
Gets current value of property editable.

Determines whether the editor content can be modified by the user. When set to "false" there might not be any editor toolbar.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getEditorLocation

returnValue.description: Value of property editorLocation

methods.description:
Gets current value of property editorLocation.

Relative or absolute URL where the editor is available. Must be on the same server. Note: Any attempts to set this property after the first rendering will not have any effect.

Default value is js/tiny_mce4/tinymce.js.

deprecated.text: The editorLocation is set implicitly when choosing the editorType.

methods.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.25.0. The editorLocation is set implicitly when choosing the editorType.

methods.name: getEditorType

returnValue.description: Value of property editorType

methods.description:
Gets current value of property editorType.

The editor implementation to use.

Valid values are the ones found under sap.ui.richtexteditor.EditorType and any other editor identifier that may be introduced by other groups (hence this is not an enumeration).

Notes:

  • TinyMCE version 3 is no longer supported and cannot be used. If you set the property to TinyMCE, it will load TinyMCE version 4.
  • Any attempts to set this property after the first rendering will not have any effect.

Default value is TinyMCE4.

methods.name: getHeight

returnValue.description: Value of property height

methods.description:
Gets current value of property height.

Height of RichTextEditor control in CSS units. Note: If the height property results in a value smaller than 200px, the minimum height of 200px will be applied.

methods.name: sap.ui.richtexteditor.RichTextEditor.getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.richtexteditor.RichTextEditor.

methods.name: getNativeApi

returnValue.description: The native editor object (here: The TinyMCE editor instance)

methods.description: Returns the current editor's instance. CAUTION: using the native editor introduces a dependency to that editor and breaks the wrapping character of the RichTextEditor control, so it should only be done in justified cases.

methods.name: getPlugins

returnValue.description: Value of property plugins

methods.description:
Gets current value of property plugins.

An array of plugin configuration objects with the obligatory property "name". Each object has to contain a property "name" which then contains the plugin name/ID.

Default value is [].

methods.name: getRequired

returnValue.description: Value of property required

methods.description:
Gets current value of property required.

Determines whether a value is required.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getSanitizeValue

returnValue.description: Value of property sanitizeValue

methods.description:
Gets current value of property sanitizeValue.

Determines whether to run the HTML sanitizer once the value (HTML markup) is applied or not. To configure allowed URLs please use the whitelist API via jQuery.sap.addUrlWhitelist

Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowGroupClipboard

returnValue.description: Value of property showGroupClipboard

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showGroupClipboard.

Determines whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Cut, Copy and Paste is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowGroupFont

returnValue.description: Value of property showGroupFont

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showGroupFont.

Determines whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Font, Font Size and Colors is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowGroupFontStyle

returnValue.description: Value of property showGroupFontStyle

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showGroupFontStyle.

Determines whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Bold, Italic, Underline and Strikethrough is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowGroupInsert

returnValue.description: Value of property showGroupInsert

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showGroupInsert.

Determines whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Insert Image and Insert Smiley is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowGroupLink

returnValue.description: Value of property showGroupLink

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showGroupLink.

Determines whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Create Link and Remove Link is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowGroupStructure

returnValue.description: Value of property showGroupStructure

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showGroupStructure.

Determines whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Bullets and Indentation is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowGroupTextAlign

returnValue.description: Value of property showGroupTextAlign

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showGroupTextAlign.

Determines whether the toolbar button group containing text alignment commands is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowGroupUndo

returnValue.description: Value of property showGroupUndo

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showGroupUndo.

Determines whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Undo and Redo is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getTextDirection

returnValue.description: Value of property textDirection

methods.description:
Gets current value of property textDirection.

The text direction

Default value is Inherit.

methods.name: getUseLegacyTheme

returnValue.description: Value of property useLegacyTheme

methods.description:
Gets current value of property useLegacyTheme.

Determines whether or not to use the legacy theme for the toolbar buttons. If this is set to false, the default theme for the editor will be used (which might change slightly with every update). The legacy theme has the disadvantage that not all functionality has its own icon, so using non default buttons might lead to invisible buttons with the legacy theme - use the default editor theme in this case.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getValue

returnValue.description: Value of property value

methods.description:
Gets current value of property value.

An HTML string representing the editor content. Because this is HTML, the value cannot be generically escaped to prevent cross-site scripting, so the application is responsible for doing so. Overwriting this property would also reset editor's Undo manager and buttons "Undo"/"Redo" would be set to their initial state.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getWidth

returnValue.description: Value of property width

methods.description:
Gets current value of property width.

Width of RichTextEditor control in CSS units.

methods.name: getWrapping

returnValue.description: Value of property wrapping

methods.description:
Gets current value of property wrapping.

Determines whether the text in the editor is wrapped. This does not affect the editor's value, only the representation in the control.

Default value is true.

methods.name: indexOfCustomButton

returnValue.description: The index of the provided control in the aggregation if found, or -1 otherwise

parameters.name: oCustomButton
parameters.description: The customButton whose index is looked for

methods.description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.core.Control in the aggregation customButtons. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

methods.name: insertCustomButton

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oCustomButton
parameters.description: The customButton to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted

parameters.name: iIndex
parameters.description: The 0-based index the customButton should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the customButton is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the customButton is inserted at the last position

methods.description: Inserts a customButton into the aggregation customButtons.

methods.name: removeAllCustomButtons

returnValue.description: An array of the removed elements (might be empty)

methods.description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation customButtons.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

methods.name: removeCustomButton

returnValue.description: The removed customButton or null

parameters.name: vCustomButton
parameters.description: The customButton to remove or its index or id

methods.description: Removes a customButton from the aggregation customButtons.

methods.name: removePlugin

returnValue.description: Control instance (for method chaining)

parameters.name: sPluginName
parameters.description: The name/ID of the plugin to remove

methods.description: Removes the plugin with the given name/ID from the list of plugins to load

methods.name: setButtonGroups

returnValue.description: Control instance (for method chaining)

parameters.name: aGroups
parameters.description: Array of names or objects containing the group information

methods.description: Sets the button groups to the editor.

methods.name: setCustomToolbar

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bCustomToolbar
parameters.description: New value for property customToolbar

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property customToolbar.

Determines whether a Fiori Toolbar is used instead of the TinyMCE default toolbar one. It is applied only when the EditorType is TinyMCE4 and sap.m library is loaded. Note: The customToolbar property will have effect only on initial loading. Changing it during runtime will not affect the initially loaded toolbar.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.name: setEditable

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bEditable
parameters.description: New value for property editable

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property editable.

Determines whether the editor content can be modified by the user. When set to "false" there might not be any editor toolbar.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setEditorLocation

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sEditorLocation
parameters.description: New value for property editorLocation

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property editorLocation.

Relative or absolute URL where the editor is available. Must be on the same server. Note: Any attempts to set this property after the first rendering will not have any effect.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is js/tiny_mce4/tinymce.js.

deprecated.text: The editorLocation is set implicitly when choosing the editorType.

methods.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.25.0. The editorLocation is set implicitly when choosing the editorType.

methods.name: setEditorType

returnValue.description: Control instance (for method chaining)

parameters.name: sEditorType
parameters.description: Which editor type to be used (currently only TinyMCE 3 and 4)

methods.description: Switches the editor type and sets the default settings for the editor. All plugins and button groups should be set after this has been invoked

methods.name: setHeight

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sHeight
parameters.description: New value for property height

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property height.

Height of RichTextEditor control in CSS units. Note: If the height property results in a value smaller than 200px, the minimum height of 200px will be applied.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setPlugins

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sPlugins
parameters.description: New value for property plugins

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property plugins.

An array of plugin configuration objects with the obligatory property "name". Each object has to contain a property "name" which then contains the plugin name/ID.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is [].

methods.name: setRequired

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bRequired
parameters.description: New value for property required

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property required.

Determines whether a value is required.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.name: setSanitizeValue

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bSanitizeValue
parameters.description: New value for property sanitizeValue

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property sanitizeValue.

Determines whether to run the HTML sanitizer once the value (HTML markup) is applied or not. To configure allowed URLs please use the whitelist API via jQuery.sap.addUrlWhitelist

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setShowGroupClipboard

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShowGroupClipboard
parameters.description: New value for property showGroupClipboard

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property showGroupClipboard.

Determines whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Cut, Copy and Paste is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setShowGroupFont

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShowGroupFont
parameters.description: New value for property showGroupFont

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property showGroupFont.

Determines whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Font, Font Size and Colors is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.name: setShowGroupFontStyle

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShowGroupFontStyle
parameters.description: New value for property showGroupFontStyle

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property showGroupFontStyle.

Determines whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Bold, Italic, Underline and Strikethrough is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setShowGroupInsert

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShowGroupInsert
parameters.description: New value for property showGroupInsert

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property showGroupInsert.

Determines whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Insert Image and Insert Smiley is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.name: setShowGroupLink

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShowGroupLink
parameters.description: New value for property showGroupLink

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property showGroupLink.

Determines whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Create Link and Remove Link is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.name: setShowGroupStructure

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShowGroupStructure
parameters.description: New value for property showGroupStructure

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property showGroupStructure.

Determines whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Bullets and Indentation is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setShowGroupTextAlign

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShowGroupTextAlign
parameters.description: New value for property showGroupTextAlign

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property showGroupTextAlign.

Determines whether the toolbar button group containing text alignment commands is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setShowGroupUndo

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShowGroupUndo
parameters.description: New value for property showGroupUndo

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property showGroupUndo.

Determines whether the toolbar button group containing commands like Undo and Redo is available. Changing this after the initial rendering will result in some visible redrawing.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.name: setTextDirection

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sTextDirection
parameters.description: New value for property textDirection

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property textDirection.

The text direction

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is Inherit.

methods.name: setUseLegacyTheme

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bUseLegacyTheme
parameters.description: New value for property useLegacyTheme

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property useLegacyTheme.

Determines whether or not to use the legacy theme for the toolbar buttons. If this is set to false, the default theme for the editor will be used (which might change slightly with every update). The legacy theme has the disadvantage that not all functionality has its own icon, so using non default buttons might lead to invisible buttons with the legacy theme - use the default editor theme in this case.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setValue

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sValue
parameters.description: New value for property value

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property value.

An HTML string representing the editor content. Because this is HTML, the value cannot be generically escaped to prevent cross-site scripting, so the application is responsible for doing so. Overwriting this property would also reset editor's Undo manager and buttons "Undo"/"Redo" would be set to their initial state.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: setWidth

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sWidth
parameters.description: New value for property width

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property width.

Width of RichTextEditor control in CSS units.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setWrapping

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bWrapping
parameters.description: New value for property wrapping

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property wrapping.

Determines whether the text in the editor is wrapped. This does not affect the editor's value, only the representation in the control.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.richtexteditor.RichTextEditor
